    • Method Detail

      • begin

        public void begin​(float x,
                  float y)
        Begins the depth sampling process, with the specified viewport space coordinate (lower-left origin) to sample for depth at. The method, end() must once the sampling process is complete.

        The client must observe the following after invoking begin(float, float) and before invoking end()

        • Do not invoke GLES20.glViewport(int, int, int, int)
        • Do not invoke GLES20.glScissor(int, int, int, int)
        • Do not invoke GLES20.glDisable(int) with GLES20Constants.GL_SCISSOR_TEST
        • Do not invoke GLES20.glEnable(int) with GLES20Constants.GL_BLEND
        • Do not invoke GLES20.glUseProgram(int)
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -

      • getClipSpaceZ

        public float getClipSpaceZ()
        Retrieves the 'z' coordinate, in clipspace, for the pixel specified in begin(float, float)}.

        This method must be invoked after begin(float, float) and before end().

        Returns:

      • getDepth

        public float getDepth()
        Retrieves the 'z' coordinate, as a depth value, for the pixel specified in begin(float, float)}

        This method must be invoked after begin(float, float) and before end().

        Returns:

      • end

        public void end()

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Releases all resources associated with the Object. The Object should not be used following an invocation of this method and any usage will result in undefined and possible application ending behavior.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Disposable
